transcript.content: Snow Patrol - Run
Snow Patrol and "Run" on XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, with me is Stephen Merchant and Karl Pilkington --
Yeah.
-- so that's... three for one. I don't know. Alright?
Exciting, exciting. Oh, back again.
Um, news... news news news. Uh - breaking news is that there's only two more weeks of us before we have to go away on a little extended break again.

So um, can't give you any more details yet, we don't know when we can come back because uh, we don't know. What are we doing? We're going to um, America. We're doing the Golden Globes and then we're going to watch The Office pilot being filmed.
Yeah.
And then we got bits - I'm - I'm doing a bit of a tour. So it'll be... sort of the summertime, probably.
Yeah. Yeah.
Um... I'm - I'm saying it like they - they care.
Oh, they don't give a damn.
D'you know what I mean?
Don't give a damn.
I sometimes think that, because, um, you think oh, you don't wanna let down the people, you want to be - keep it consistent, you want to give - but really
I know I like doing this more than anyone listening.
Definitely.
D'you know what I mean?
Definitely, definitely.
I love coming in, I love squeezing Karl's head.
Yeah.
I love playing some records. You know, I like sort of sitting in a room with you. I know you love it.
Ah.
Ha ha, aye. Can't wait.
I can't think of anything else I'd rather be doing on a Saturday.
Yeah, so uh, we got our Saturdays back though.
Yeah, that'll be great.
I mean, my alarm went off today and I was a bit tired because we - we had a couple of drinks last night didn't we?
Last night yeah.
Yeah but we, you know, party, we're party animals. Um, but um, oh, I've been looking for an office this week, as you know,

And it's so stressful. Just walking around, just talking to - to agents and - right, uh, right, okay. So, my method is this, right. I walk 'round the area that I want to be - have an office in, 'cause I don't want to hear anything else, I don't wanna, you know I mean? So I walk 'round - to be fair it is about a square 500 yards.
Yeah.
Right? It's sort of --
Your house is in the center and there's --
Ricky laughs

Yeah, yeah, I walk - yeah. And uh, so I walk 'round and look at placards, I go "That's a nice office" and I phone 'em up - there's loads of different people you have to deal with, right. And they went "Oh, we got one in so-and-so street." I - I think

It was Fifth Street or something like that. I went "Oh yeah," I went along to - "and I'll see you there in 20 minutes." I got there - you were there, if you remember. I looked around and I said to Steve, it looks alright, there's no - no - no porn shops or anything like that, right. And Steve went "Well, it is next to a brothel." And I looked and there on the next thing, like, you know "model, first floor." Uh, "Susie, 03" - and I phoned him up and I said, "D'you know what? Um, don't bother coming here." He went "No?" I said, no, I said "'Cause it's next to a brothel." He went "Yeah." I went "Right, okay, just for future reference, I don't want
An office literally next to a brothel."
Steve laughs
Right? When I go to work, I don't want to walk past prostitutes - call me old-fashioned.
Yeah, as you're going into work, there's the prostitute. "Morning." "Morning."
"Morning." "Morning." Ohhh - "I just got a cappuccino." "Yeah?" "Starbucks, yeah." "Uh, business good?" "Yeah, it's a bit slow at the moment but it picks up later this evening." --
Steve laughs

-- "Does it really? Good." And uh - I said - I said to him - I've got so, so - my - my New Year's resolution is being like a little fascist when it comes to business and - and I said uh, uh - "Also future reference,

Um, uh - no, no crack dens, and no wild animals in the porch." And uh, I - I just can't believe that there's always something wrong. We went to one, right, we got there, right? And uh - the woman said "Oh, I'm new here," she didn't - she didn't have - didn't know what keys she was using, and she went - it's the third floor - and uh, she went "There's no point, we won't both get in the lift." I went "Right, will you get a desk in the lift?" Right? She went "I've got a chair in the lift before."
Steve laughs
Brilliant. So --
Yeah.
-- just find me an office.
Rathbone Place, sort of Percy Street, Charlotte Street, Dean Street.
Yeah.
Yeah? First or second floor.
I'm worried we're gonna get emails from estate agents, phone calls from um, you know what those people are like.
I don't look at emails.
Fair enough.
So, play a record.
Sexist.
Steve laughs
Joe Jackson, Different For Girls.
That's why he's not in the charts anymore.
I can't believe it!
Unbelievable. You were talking about renting an office. I'm a little bit intimidated 'cause I'm just at the moment thinking about trying to buy a flat.
Sure.
Because I'm just tired of pissing money down the drain.
I know. Yeah.

And um, but I'm just I'm really petrified. I put it off and put it off because I just, I'm really gullible. I'm just, when I'm in confronted with anyone in a suit, who sort of knows what they're talking about, they can sell me anything, I'm intimidated. It's like, you know how you're supposed to go in there and you're supposed to sort of act like you're the guy with the money, you're, this is what I want and this is what I nah, nah, nah. I go in there and it's like I'm afraid they're going to say, "Clear off. I don't want this, I don't want to sell you a house. I'm not interested."
Have you ever thought of like, really putting on sort of like, some sort of cool air? Like sort of kicking the door and going, "Well wood's not oak."
Steve laughs
He'd be found out in 30 seconds, wouldn't you? You'd go in there, you'd stub your toe and they'd go, "What are you kicking off about your toe?" Brilliant.
Just tapping the walls.
Yeah, tapping the walls. "What's the, what's the rates like?" "What rates?" "I don't know."

Well this is, do you remember? I don't know if I told you, before I went, I wanted to buy a laptop computer. Everyone said go up Tottenham Court Road, and I was reading like, magazines and stuff and they were saying, "Haggle. Make sure you haggle. Make sure you got a real plan in to haggle, get the best deal you can," and I found a shop which was selling the computer I wanted and I went in there and I had this whole plan in my mind of what was gonna happen. He was going to say like, "It's worth this." I'm going to go like, "Well look, I can get it cheaper here.

I want to buy it from you. I'm going to haggle," and off I went. So I went in the shop and I said, "Yeah looking for this, interested in this Toshiba. How much is it?" He went, "Oh it's £1500," I went, "Sure, sure." I said, "I'll give you 1300," he went, "It's 1500." I said, "Sure but I'm willing to give you the 1300." He went, "1500" and I was done already because he hadn't even begun to haggle. I was assuming he'd at least go, "1400" and we could start but nothing. So now I'm screwed. My whole plan went out the window.
Yeah, what'd you do? Just leave?

No I said to him, I said "The thing is, I can get this computer cheaper down the road, but you know, I like what you're providing here, I like your service. I've heard good stuff about you." And he went, I said "Seriously, I can walk down the street. I can buy it now for cheap, for like 1400," and he went, "Well, see you later then," and I was like, "Right." So I walked out the place. I said, "Well, I'm going to leave then," and I walked out the place and of course I wanted to get it from there because it was still the cheapest, so I had to walk back in again! I went, "Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah. I've just had some second thoughts. Listen. I'll tell you what, I'll pay you the 1500. Can I get a free carry case?"
He went, "The carry case is free anyway." I said, "I'll take it."
Ricky laughs
The carry case is free anyway!
I got nothing!

No but how much would you charge for that if it was on sale? The carry case is a tenner. Well, let's just say is a tenner. Give it to me for free. And he went, "No, it's a tenner." And you went, "Well you said it was free a minute ago!"
It was just pathetic.
That is lovely.
It's having to walk out, making a big statement and then come back in again.
Oh, oh dear.
So I just, I'm really scared. I just, I feel like I need someone to come with me and do all the talking. You know, know what they're talking about because I don't--
...be able to tell if there's subsidence, or if there's damp or...
No, but you don't do that,
Don't I? Are they not my responsibility?
No, you get a survey done.
Sure
...and then they charge for that, and then, yeah, you don't have to go around doing it yourself.
Right, Can I make a saving if I did it myself?
Yeah, this should be all right. "Yeah, there's this hole in the wall, Steve"... "Yeah, but what's a hole in the wall?"
Put some newspaper over that.
"In Chaucer's day that was the toilet. That'll be fine." Karl, you're a second time buyer, aren't you?
Yeah yeah yeah, bought one in Manchester.
Uh, Lost seven grand on that one.
Well, Don't buy Manchester!
No, it's a good flat, it just wasn't - I didn't buy it to sorta make money. I thought was going to be living there like, all me life, and then a job come up here-
Brilliant
And it's like, Uh.
You bought your first flat in Manchester - you assumed you would be living there for the rest of your life. Karl: Well, I wasn't in a rush.
Play a record. You're an idiot.
Hold on a minute, So have you got a property portfolio? Have you got the two houses?
No. No, I've got rid of that one... got this flat
Oh, you sold that one, at a seven thousand pound loss?
Got this flat... I'll tell you something that is interesting-
Hold on though-
What?
£7,000 lost
Ya
... on a flat in Manchester, but it could only cost about eight grand anyway.
Alright Steve, something that they do now, right, they've got to do by law, when you're buying, right? I was looking at one, in London, right? It's haunted - they've gotta tell you now.
Right, don't talk shit.
I'm telling you now-
Play a record.
I'm telling you now.
Yeah, there's no such thing as ghosts, that is ridiculous if that appears on a legal document.

Right, if there's anyone who sells flats and that, does that for a living, right, email in. Because I'm telling you now that that is a fact. She sorta dropped it in, she sorta- I said, "Oh, you know, nice nice feel here." And she said, "Yeah, Well, that will be the the ghost." Just dropped it in. That's all they've got to do, and then I was like "What?" And they went, "oh, yeah".
That's what they've got to do, is it? That's the legal thing is it? So in court you go, "So did you drop it in?" "Yeah, I dropped it in" Play a record, you're an idiot.
David Grey, "This Year's Love"
That's David Grey and "This Year's Love", if you're in love I hope it lasts, it's only January. Uh, what do you got? What do you got for us Steve?

I just thought maybe we ought to go through some of the emails. I mean, I don't want to query the caliber of some of the emails we get sent on this show, but um, here's a typical one Rick. There's no name, it's just from Glicko, that's his email address. It's just a question to you Rick, "Did I see you walking around Marylebone High Street last Sunday?
Yes.
Okay.
Well, I don't know. But, I was in Marylebone High Street last Sunday. Yeah.
Yeah, but did you see Glicko?
I didn't see Glicks. I didn't see the Glickster but uh..
Alright, this is one from "Em". "Ricky, What do you think of Richard Bacon's show? I can't decide if he's better than you."
Uh, Nor can I-
Any thoughts?

Nor can I, I can't help her out on that one. That's a really personal thing. She's got to dig deep. She's got to look at both of us. She's gotta find out what she likes, and then whether I provide more of that than Bakers
Uh, I mean, you know baker foils brilliant.
Yeah,
I'm not gonna put myself up against him. So I can't help you, next Steve, next.
Well, There was a lot of emails last week which was saying how much they enjoyed the Christmas special. Thank you very much for that, it's very flattering.
Cheers

There was also a couple, there was one, it was a guy, I'm sorry that, I think I might have deleted it, but, err, I should have sent a reply, because it was a guy from Canada saying "is there any chance you around in March, whether you could pop in and have a surprise birthday dinner for his wife".
Ugh, Why didn't you keep that?
I know, sorry about that.
Now I can't bloody go!
- Can I? You idiot. Okay-
So I, I don't - I really apologize for that. There's also - this is interesting. This is more for Karl really. It seems unlikely that Karl's-
Is it from a doctor saying "you're an idiot"?
Um, we've got plenty of those I tend to delete them.
Okay. All right. Yeah.
They're so common.
Yeah. Yeah, look at his face.
No, it just says, you know, don't like to complain but I won the film competition like five or six weeks ago and I haven't received my prizes.
Oh dear. That's all that Karl, that's all Karl has to do on this show. We provide the chat, the records, the light entertainment. I mean -
The glamour-
-strokes of comedy genius. All Karl has to do is send out the prizes and say there was a monkey that was a bank robber at five to three. Karl!
What's your excuse Karl?
Um? Do you remember her winning? I've got all, I've got all the
Are you calling her a liar?
Well, I am, because I don't remember ever seeing that address -
Right. He's calling her a liar.
So Joanne Ogden you're claiming is just making this up. She sent this in on a whim trying to fool us and get some cheap tat.
Well...
I don't believe that, I don't believe anyone would lie to try and get "Knowing Me Knowing You" on VHS. I really don't.
Well, I'll look in the records, because we keep all the details, so... You know what I mean?
Right, Well one of you's in the wrong and do you know what, knowing you Karl, I don't think it's Joanne.
No
Has anyone else ever emailed in saying they haven't got the uh, bag of crap? No, they haven't, they haven't.
Well one mistakes one too far, because that's one person -  you, you might send out 30, but that one person, that's the first time they've won a competition.
They, they want "The History of Wind" narrated by Donal McIntyre, on VHS, and you know-
Stephen King's "It", on BetaMax.
Yeah. Yeah, sometimes they want the best of Primal Scream on cassette.

Exactly, you've got to make sure you're sending these prizes out. Final email from Andy. He says, "The webcam is pointing at the ceiling. Is it because the air-conditioning vent is more exciting than what happens on the show?"
Let's put that down now.
I think that's absolutely right.
Now, if someone, is that good?
People love the webcam. I don't know what they're interested in, 'cause all their getting is a picture of Karl's big head.
It's not big, it's just round.
Get it right.
Ricky Laughs

Um, Karl, I like you to play the next tune. Um, I got sent a little cheeky primer for The Cure's, "Join The Dots", just b-sides and Rarities lots of stuff from them from all over the ages, and it's amazing how good their b-sides are here's one of them, play it.
Yeah
The Cure - "A Man Inside My Mouth"
The Cure, and that's called "A Man Inside My Mouth" which was the B-side to "Close to Me", there's nothing amusing about that Rick, so I don't know why you're laughing.
Well...
It's called "A Man Inside My Mouth"
I know.
And that's fine.
Yeah, it's like the little man inside your head.
Yeah, you know, if a man wants to be inside anyone's mouth that's good, you know, good luck to them. What, there's nothing wrong with that.
But I agree.
Karl, do you agree with that?
What man in your head? What does that mean?
(laughs) It's brilliant, isn't it?
Extraordinary. Look at his face.
He doesn't even understand school boy carry on innuendo.
Amazing.
I love the fact that the play on words is too far. 'What does he mean unsightly erection? What?'
Um
'What do you mean dumplings? Huh?'
You're a fan of The Simpsons.
Yeah.
You know that character in The Simpsons, the um gap-toothed yokel?
Yeah.
If I look at Karl when he's perplexed-
Cletus.
Cletus, exactly right.
(laughing) Yeah.
Especially-it's that-it's the kind of cliche comic book thing of having a mouth wide open.
(laughs)
To suggest gormlessness. (makes grunting noise, imitating Karl).
It's amazing.
Or, an accommodating come on.
Yes, absolutely.
Karl.
Alright?
'Little man inside your head'. It's what-you know-people use it as your conscience, don't they?
Oh right.
You've never heard that before?
No.
No?
No.
No? Okay.
I was eh-Rick, I was watching Moonraker uh it was on-I think it was last week.
Yeah.
Em, I don't know how familiar you are with the James Bond films.
I have never-
-I don't think I've ever watched a Bond film from beginning to end.
Yeah.
I've never watched one on DVD. I've never gone to the cinema to watch one. And I'm not usually in on Easter Saturday.
(laughs) Exactly.
Em-Honestly.

The thing about James Bond-when I was younger, I thought he was amazing. I just thought he was the ultimate cool, sophisticated hero. Do you know what I mean? My dream as a kid-when I say 'a kid' I mean a teenager-was to come home-which invariably he did, he'd come back to his hotel suite-he'd open the door. There'd be a trail of clothes...and he'd follow it, go into the bedroom, there'd be a beautiful
Woman in the bed. You know?
You'd have said 'Clean up my clo-what are you doing? You're messy! I'm gonna get my mum to clean all this up now'.
'Mum!'
'And she's got a bad back.'
'There's a nudie lady in my bed!'
(laughs)
Um, but uh, and as I say I used to think he was really cool and sophisticated. And it's only of late that I've sort of watched and revisited these films. And, I'll tell you what, it's his jokes.
Oh! Oh his sense of humour.
He is the most infuriating man ever.
Yeah. Absolutely.
I mean, I don't know why people in the films consider him so
I think the reason that women in the films are always being seduced by him is because if you notice they've normally got English as a second language.
Right.
So they don't understand. So when he's making those jokes-
So they don't know when he goes uh, 'Uh just keeping the British end up.'
Yeah. 'I'm just attempting re-entry'.
Yeah.
If that was a British woman she'd be going 'WHAT?!'
Yeah.
'What are you talking about?!'
'Don't say that'.
'Dirty bastard!'
'That sounds awful and it's a terrible pun Roger'
'It's so lewd! What am I?'
(laughing) Yeah, 'What am I?', yeah yeah. And they just laugh.
They just laugh (inaudible word) and then you know unzip their dress normally.
(laughs) Yeah.
But some of the gags-there was one where he's

Eh he's being chased by a guy-moped or something and the guy plummets off a cliff and smashes through a van which is full of feathers and he plummets to his death and Bond just says 'All those feathers and he still couldn't fly'. What are you talking about?!
(laughs)
What do you mean? That's not a joke! It's just words!
(laughs) Oh...
There's one where he-in Moonraker he punches this guy-he's having a fight-he punches him through a plate glass window and he lands on a piano and Bond goes 'Play it again, Sam'.
(laughs)
What?! I always remember-there's one in one of the early films where he-
He throws a guy in the bath and electrocutes him by throwing in a uhm... a thing.
Oh! A...
And then he goes "Absolutely shocking!"
"Sh- shocking!" Yeah.
But I was thinking "You've just killed a man!"
I know! Well, I mean...
"You're a psychopath!"
*chuckling* Yeah, yeah...
And it's just... It's just so excrucia- If someone was doing those kind of jokes in the office... You would hate them!
Yeah!
D'you know what I mean? You wouldn't want to talk to 'em, they'd be a bore...
I know, yeah. Everything... Everything's a little one-liner...
Everything's a one-liner!
...And everything's a pun.
Yeah!
But I'll tell you what. He's a bloody good secret agent, Steve.
Steve laughs
That's true!
So, you know... They're- They're not hired for their uhm... You know, wit and uhh... You know, stand-up ability.
Steve laughs
Exactly...
Uhm... So, you know... It's swings and roundabouts.
Yeah, yeah.
I doubt Johnny Vegas could err... Save the world.
That's true enough, yeah.
So, err... Think on... Different people, different needs!
Unknown - Unknown
Kings of Leon - California Waiting

Kings of Leon - California Waiting on Xfm 104.9. D'you know what, Steve. We get emails and uhh... You know, we got our posters up round this show and uhh... People enjoy it. But I don't think we get the credit we deserve for picking the music.
It's true.

'Cause we're totally unplaylisted and... I don't know if people know about this that... M- Mine and Steve's sort of first passion before comedy is probably music. We're really, really... We love playing each other sort of records and that. And maybe when we come back we should do a show... Where there is no pressure... To, you know... Like, Karl doesn't press the buttons for us, pre-record it. Where we just... We swap each other sort of ideas for music.
It'll be like uhh... "The Ricky Gervais Compilation Tape."

Well, sort of like... We're not- We're not talking John Peel where we'll try and find obscure Belgian jungle and do demos. You know... Be everything from, you know... Kings of Leon... Lou Reed, you know. Maybe a bit of eighties stuff, that people have forgotten about?
Yeah, yeah, yeah. Beautiful songs, beautiful songs...
So what d'ya think?

I'd love to do that, Rick. I mean, I genuinely... I- There's nothing more exciting to me than introducing to someone a song which they then go on and they love, and they listen... Maybe they buy the album, duh duh duh...
Absolutely. But that's summat to think about maybe for later...
Yeah! Well it's like you say, the- the pressure to kind of come up with some, you know, uhm- high caliber chat...
Yeah.
...Between each record. It is- it takes the toll, you know?
But uhm... Yeah. And tha- that's, you know... It's a passion of ours and we'd love to- bu- but now, it's Rockbusters!

Can I just say something now before we do Rockbusters? A lot of people sort of, they come up to me and they say "Steve, we like the show. When're you going to get rid of Rockbusters? It's- it brings it down." I'm not joking!
Who said that?
I'm not joking! There is loads of people...
Come on, let- let Karl speak!
Come off it! Come off it! Come off it.
What? What?
I know people who say "You're never gonna stop that, are ya?" So... One of us is lyin' again.
Ricky laughs
Well, not really. You know...
Oh, I love his face!
I- I'm talking about people who've listened to the show, you're talking about Suzanne. Your girlfriend.
No, Martin... He'll be at home now with a pad, getting ready to play.
But I should just...
Martin Freeman did- did say... Did encourage Karl on a couple of occasions. He even tried to get him through with the answer "egg", when we were doing that "name an animal" -round. So...

Yes. But I should just say that people, they... People think that somehow Ricky and I are endorsing Rockbusters. That somehow by allowing it on the show, somehow we think it's good or we appreciate it. And I need to point out that it's more like when a child comes back from school, and they've done a painting...
Yeah, yeah.
It's crap, but of course you've got to stick it on the fridge.
The cat is bigger than the house. Yeah.
You've got to stick it on the fridge, because otherwise the kid's gonna get upset...
Exactly. In this next excerpt you've got to remember the cat is bigger than the house. Okay?
*chuckles* Exactly. It doesn't look like anything.
The humans don't have bodies, their legs come straight from their head.
Yeah. "Mommy and Daddy..."
Please welcome to the stage, Karl Pilkington's Rockbusters!
Alright?
Ricky laughs
Right, so uhh... Cryptic clues...
No, they're not cryptic.
...initials, and you work it out and you email in an' that.
Yeah.
First one...
Yeah.
Err... Don't be stealing my tools, take your sister's!
Steve laughs
Alright? And the initials, NK. So...
Don't be stealing me tools, take me sister's?
Yeah, so that's like the cryptic clue and the initials of the artist or band is NK. Right? Second one... Buy it if you want, I'm not bothered, think about it. Come back, right? Come back if you want.
Ricky laughs
Start again, Karl! I got lost halfway through! Right, start that second one again!
Right, well... You can buy...
Ricky laughs
Different! It's different! Well, the first one was "Buy if it you want..." now this one was "Yeah, well right?" Right. Do it. Do it, if it's a cryptic clue all the letters count. Do it.
Buy it if you want, I'm not that bothered. You know? Think about it, come back. Check some other places out first before you... You know...
Ricky and Steve laugh
Imagine if that was a crossword clue in the Times! Sorry we've got no time for other clues! Right.
Alright? So that's SC.
Right. Do that clue again.
Buy it if you want, I'm not... I'm not fussed, you know what I mean? Think about it.
Ricky and Steve laugh
"Fussed!" "Fussed" has made an appearance! "Fussed" wasn't there before! Do the clue again. Do the clue again!
Ricky laughs
*chuckling* Initials SC for that one.
Do the clue again!
No, I don't wanna do it again!
You haven't finished it yet?
I have, that's it!
No, do the clue again.
Karl laughs
No, I can't do it...
SC.
Do the clue again.
Buy it if you want, I'm not fussed. Right? Shop around... Come back... It's up to you. I'm not pushing you into anything, right?
Ricky laughs
Different again! "It's up to you" wasn't there! Oh dear...
S... SC. SC for that one, right? And the final one...
Yeah?
Err... That's good, I can play ten-pin bowling again.
Ricky laughs
Oh, Christ!
Okay, and what's the clue?
That's O for that one. O.
O.
Alright? So, they're the three clues.
Okay, now, I assume... I'm not gonna bother to look, but I assume there's a... There's a jiffy bag of tat which people can win.
Yeah.
Alright. Well, great. Good luck. Uhm... ricky.gervais@xfm.co.uk is the email address.
Christ... Play a record.
Thorns?
*imitating Karl* "Buy it if you wan't, I'm not fussed. You can come back, have a look 'round. I'm open Wednesdays, by the way. See ya later..."
The Thorns - No Blue Sky

The Thorns and "No Blue Sky". Uhm... Off their album, err... Of last year, which is probably my favourite album of the year. I've started getting into that, sort of like music more serious thing, in case we do it.
Yeah. I mean, I don't know. From that comment, maybe we should do some preparation.
Pre... Pre-record it!
Yeah.
So we can sort of like, cut all the uhms and errs, and...
Like that sentence there.
And me sort of like, eating a sandwich while it's on.
Yeah
Singing along... Tappin' a little bit. Yeah.
Yeah.
I won't lay down like this either. We'll get me a chair that I can sort of be upright so I can annunciate.
You weren't in the room, were you, when uhm... Karl was singing along to "Oliver's Army"?
No.
It was a joy. *Mumbling* Checkpoint Charlie... *Mumbling* Oliver's Army...
Ricky and Steve laugh
No idea!
Aww... bless him! Rockbusters well on the way. Any err... Any right answers yet, Karl?
I'll just check...
Let's see, we got uhh one email.
One email? Uhh.
No.
No, because they probably don't make sense.
Yep. No, no, no responses what so ever.
